ui.title: Law Enforcement Support
ui.subtitle: Guidance for survivors who wish to consult with law enforcement or file criminal complaints.
ui.hotline_desc: The Cybercrime Investigation and Coordinating Center (CICC) is mandated to provide immediate technical assistance and coordinate investigations into cybercrime.
ui.vawc_desc: If you need officers trained specifically for Violence Against Women and Children (VAW-C) cases, please contact the PNP specialize unit.
ui.wcpc_name: PNP Women and Children Protection Center (WCPC)
ui.expect_desc: Filing a complaint is a formal process. Here is what happens when you reach out:
ui.expect_step_1_desc: Officers will listen to your situation and assess the potential violations.
ui.expect_step_2_desc: You will be asked to provide evidence (screenshots, links, etc).
ui.expect_step_3_desc: DICT-CICC coordinates with relevant platforms and law enforcement units to act on your case.
ui.ra_10175_desc: What is the Cybercrime Prevention Act?
ui.cyberbullying_desc: How to file a complaint in the PH
ui.footer_desc: Are you a victim of impersonation or data privacy violation instead?
